alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 11:48AM CDT until May 15 at 10:53PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...from Telegraph to Segovia to 15 miles east of Junction. Movement was slowly northwest. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Yates Crossing, Telegraph, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 453 and 471. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, Old Segovia Rd. crossing Johnson Fork, County Road 430 crossing Joy Creek, KC 451 crossing Johnson Fork, crossings along County Road 410 and KC 314 crossing Llano River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
